subject: [Announcement] JsUnit 1.1 released
msgSnippet: Hi, I would like to announce JsUnit 1.1 a port of JsUnit 3.2 to JavaScript. Main goal of the port is a system that can be invoked by command line returning
messageBody:
Hi,

I would like to announce JsUnit 1.1 a port of JsUnit 3.2 to JavaScript. Main goal of the port is a system that can be invoked by command line returning with an exit code to allow automated tests as long as the environment support this scenario. Despite the command line tools the port supports also common browsers that have exceptions for JavaScript implemented.

Currently tested systems:
- Microsoft Internet Explorer 4.x and 5.x
- Windows Scripting Host 2.x
- Visual InterDev 6.0
- iPlanet WebServer 4.x
- Netscape 6.x
- Mozilla 0.8x and 0.9x
- Rhino 1.5
- SpiderMonkey 1.5

Systems that are supposed to work:
- BroadVision OneToOne 5.x
- IIS 5.x

Systems that currently fail due to their implementations:
- KDE Konqueror 0.9.8
- Day Communiqué 2.6
- Opera 5.12 (Windows)
- Netscape 4.7x
- iPlanet Web Server 6.x (JavaScript support dropped)

Check out at http://jsunit.berlios.de

Regards,
Jörg
